22
THE NON-EXISTENCE AND LOSS OF A HEREDITARY RIGHT
(1) A spouse shall not have a hereditary right when the marriage to the decedent has been annulled or declared invalid, or if the relationship has permanently ceased whereby the surviving spouse is the guilty party or the relationship has been dissolved by mutual consent.
(2) A spouse shall lose the hereditary right if the decedent has initiated a divorce action and it is established after the decedent's death that the action was substantiated or if the marriage is declared invalid after the decedent's death for a reason known to the surviving partner at the time of marriage.
